column5: Has anyone relised opener this year is on mothersday weekend!I had to cancel my reservation for the first time in 12 years! this is really going to hurt the Kiwanis derby or maybe aleast employ a few divorce lawyers!I,m totally bummed been planning for months but never relised it until today, 4 very dissapointed guyz for sure!

Saw that when I first looked at the calendar last year to figure out the opening weekend dates.  I'll have my son visit to fish Sat/Sun and visit his mother later on Sunday for supper.  Works for me.  David  aka  Superdad
I am gonna buy my old lady a new chain saw or wood splitter to make up for it.  But seriously, thanks for the heads up.
LOL... like Leah always says, do what you want... "I'm not your Mother"! That's the kid's problem....now that they should be old enough to do their own things for her.
I thought that it almost always was on Mother's Day!
Bring Mom with ya.....sheesh....got ta tell you guyz everything!!!
The Kawartha opener is almost always on Mother's Day, Quinte opens the week before.  May must be starting on a Sunday.
Amen to that!  A wise woman...I too am so lucky!  cheers.
~~~Since my mother always loved my brother more, I'll be phishen
Well i guess everything has a silver lining, found a alternative location for the following weekend, Blakewood Lodge hopely its as good as our usual place.

Actual email I just sent to my Mom.  Hey Mom, you know that fishing weekend Phil and I do every May?  Well guess what, if falls on Mothers day this year.  Therefore, we would love for you to join us.  What a great way to celebrate - you, us, and 10 other rough and tumble guys.  I have already let the guys know a woman may be coming.  So they have agreed to only fart and burp outside, use fully clothed ladies on our deck of cards, to keep a swear jar handy and we will do all the dishes after you cook.  Even Dane has agree to not walk around in his tighty whities for you.  So let me know Mom.  Sounds like a blast eh!  Of course, if you can't make it we'll stay home with you, because we love you so much and totally understand sometimes family members must make sacrifices on special days.  Lovingly your understanding son,  Paul  (Paul should never of gave me his email password)
Blakewoods is on Hay Bay and close to the hot spots on the opening weekend.  You'll see the boats from your front door.  Lotsa Luck on the opener  David  aka  Superdad Hay Bay @ Bayview Resort

Give them what they really want, A few days without you.  I used to take Dad fishing every Sunday but I stopped because it left Mom awfully busy on her own.  The other day she said how great it was to have us gone for the day.
